channel.title: Help with Linux pl0x
channel.description:
Just need to know if an inexperienced 'lower-than-script-kiddie' should use Linux.
I can't script, I hardly even know CSS/HTML. Should I use it?

item.title: Help with Linux pl0x
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

mopar, there very bad. I know. On one port, it connects to the router, on another it connects to the internet. The rest windows offers to find the installtion package for this “new device”/dosen’t get found. Beats me :S.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Linux pl0x
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I have 3 wireless network cards from belkin and not one of them works under windows or anything else, I have even tried them on multiple computers, so don’t go by that judgement.

However setting any wireless card up under linux can be a little tricky, but I would go with it if I were you, after a week or two long learning curve you will get really good with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Linux pl0x
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Daniel, post:3, topic:18188”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=27195.msg311891#msg311891 date=1160744973]
Go here.

It all depends on prefrence, I tried linux and can’t get my wireless network adaptar to work with it so I don’t see a use for it for me. But if I could manage to install wine and get it to work, then I would reinstall it on a partition.
[/quote]

I use a wireless network adapter aswell so I think that answered my question, thanks :P[/quote]

I’m using a belkin one, I did find a tut on google but it’s for a card not an adaptar. I’m sure it will work with wine, it’s just learning how to install + run wine to get it to work that’s stopping me. Windows works fine, Linux seems to be fine if you donate the effort needed to use it.

Read full topic

It all depends on prefrence, I tried linux and can’t get my wireless network adaptar to work with it so I don’t see a use for it for me. But if I could manage to install wine and get it to work, then I would reinstall it on a partition.[/quote]
